name: Coded Value for HL7 Defined Tables
description: The ID data type is used for coded values that are defined by HL7 tables. It represents a single code value selected from a predefined list of valid values as specified in HL7 tables. Unlike CE data types, ID fields contain only the code without accompanying text or alternate representations.

constraints.codeOnly: Contains only the code value, not descriptive text
constraints.predefined: Values must be from HL7-defined tables (Table 0xxx)
constraints.caseSensitive: Typically case-sensitive depending on the specific table
constraints.noComponents: Single value only - no component separators

usage: Any field referencing HL7-defined lookup tables

generationHints.typical: Use values from the appropriate HL7 table for the field
generationHints.validation: Always validate against the specific table referenced by the field
generationHints.required: Must use exact case and format as defined in the HL7 table

validationRules.tableReference: Value must exist in the referenced HL7 table
validationRules.caseMatching: Must match exact case as defined in table
validationRules.length: Must not exceed maximum length for the specific field
validationRules.mandatory: Some ID fields are required, others are optional

relatedDataTypes.CE: Coded element with text and alternate representations
relatedDataTypes.ST: Free text when no coding is available
